update.description:
Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

~~Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)~~ merged

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli)) and the ability to generate SDF from physics profiles.

Known issue(s):

In physics elements with elements of different types, e.g. `test/worlds/presets.world` has `preset1` which has `ode`, `simbody` and `bullet` blocks, `PresetManager` will attempt to set all parameters specified in the profile. An optimization would be to only set parameters for the engine that is specified in the `type` attribute of `physics`. Since this is not currently implemented, the test gives a lot of warnings, such as `[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:225] SetParam failed for [cfm] in physics engine simbody`.

~~The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for Simbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. (If/when [PR1473](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1473/) gets merged before this, I will complete the `PresetManager` test to include Simbody.~~ merged and simbody test integrated

~~For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.~~ Fixed by [PR1528](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1528/call-physicsengine-setparam-in-child/diff)
update.title: `PresetManager` for physics library

Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

~~Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)~~ merged

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli)) and the ability to generate SDF from physics profiles.

Known issue(s):

In physics elements with elements of different types, e.g. `test/worlds/presets.world` has `preset1` which has `ode`, `simbody` and `bullet` blocks, `PresetManager` will attempt to set all parameters specified in the profile. An optimization would be to only set parameters for the engine that is specified in the `type` attribute of `physics`. Since this is not currently implemented, the test gives a lot of warnings, such as `[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:225] SetParam failed for [cfm] in physics engine simbody`.

~~The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for Simbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. (If/when [PR1473](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1473/) gets merged before this, I will complete the `PresetManager` test to include Simbody.~~ merged and simbody test integrated

~~For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.~~ Fixed by [PR1528](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1528/call-physicsengine-setparam-in-child/diff)

update.description:
Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

~~Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)~~ merged

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli)) and the ability to generate SDF from physics profiles.

Known issue(s):

In physics elements with elements of different types, e.g. `test/worlds/presets.world` has `preset1` which has `ode`, `simbody` and `bullet` blocks, `PresetManager` will attempt to set all parameters specified in the profile. An optimization would be to only set parameters for the engine that is specified in the `type` attribute of `physics`. Since this is not currently implemented, the test gives a lot of warnings, such as `[Wrn] [PhysicsEngine.cc:225] SetParam failed for [cfm] in physics engine simbody`.

~~The implementation of `PresetManager` relies on `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. `SetParam` is not implemented for Simbody, so the functionality of this PR will not work with Simbody. (If/when [PR1473](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1473/) gets merged before this, I will complete the `PresetManager` test to include Simbody.~~ merged and simbody test integrated

~~For all the physics engines, `SetParam` is not fully implemented for certain parameters, so you may receive lots of gzwarnings from the `PhysicsEngine` implementation in gzserver.~~ Fixed by [PR1528](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1528/call-physicsengine-setparam-in-child/diff)

Implementation of the Physics Preset Profile API [design](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/src/e64787224f59902a986c22f7d20fdb39e24b8764/physics_presets/physics_presets.md).

~~Requires sdformat [PR146](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/146/physics-preset-attributes/diff)~~ merged

This PR adds an API for switching between different physics profiles, specified as physics blocks in SDF.

I also included 2 small fixes the ODEPhysics and SimbodyPhysics to handle exceptions.

A forthcoming PR will implement the command line interface to `PresetManager` ([preview](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/physics_presets_cli))

Known issue(s):

content.html: I implemented this change in 7ce06a3

Just to check: is something like this OK? I'd like to be sure I'm not violating PIMPL.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////
PresetPrivate::PresetPrivate(const std::string &_name = "default name")
    : name(_name)
{
}

//////////////////////////////////////////////////
Preset::Preset() : dataPtr(new PresetPrivate)
{
}

//////////////////////////////////////////////////
Preset::Preset(const std::string &_name) :
    dataPtr(new PresetPrivate(_name))
{
}

content.raw: I'll have to make a constructor (possibly also with an initialization list) for `PresetPrivate` to do this, right? Since `name` is a property of the `dataPtr`, not of the object that is getting constructed.
content.html: I'll have to make a constructor (possibly also with an initialization list) for PresetPrivate to do this, right? Since name is a property of the dataPtr, not of the object that is getting constructed.

content.raw: `ParameterMapBegin()` and `ParameterMapEnd()` do not look to me like proper methods for a public interface. Consumers of the class should don't know anything about the internal data representation (if it is a Map, a List or any other data structure) and by providing accessing directly to the data we are probably breaking the encapsulation here.
content.html: ParameterMapBegin() and ParameterMapEnd() do not look to me like proper methods for a public interface. Consumers of the class should don't know anything about the internal data representation (if it is a Map, a List or any other data structure) and by providing accessing directly to the data we are probably breaking the encapsulation here.

content.raw: this can be moved to the Initialization list
content.html: this can be moved to the Initialization list

content.raw: Refactoring Preset to be a private member class was too much pain, so instead I took your original suggestion and exposed the beginning and end iterators to the map in question, instead of a pointer to the map. Done as of 0f7b9e1. What are your thoughts on this change?
content.html: Refactoring Preset to be a private member class was too much pain, so instead I took your original suggestion and exposed the beginning and end iterators to the map in question, instead of a pointer to the map. Done as of 0f7b9e1. What are your thoughts on this change?
